== Kubuntu 16.10 to 17.04 Upgrade ==

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="background:#D2FCFF; margin: 0 0 1em 1em;" style="width:50%; padding:0.5em;"> Note: It is advisable to purge the backports PPA (if enabled) before attempting an upgrade.  To do that run in a terminal:
|-
| sudo apt-get install ppa-purge <<BR>> sudo ppa-purge ppa:kubuntu-ppa/backports
|}

If you are using a Laptop ensure the following things are done.

You will need to:
* Ensure your laptop is connected to power.
* If at all practical, ensure that you are connected to the Internet via a wired connection.
* Ensure 16.10 is updated.
* Run the release upgrade tool.
* Reboot.

For Desktops:

You will need to:
* Ensure 16.10 is updated.
* Run the release upgrade tool.
* Reboot.

=== Ensure your laptop is connected to power ===

The upgrade should run uninterrupted.

=== If at all practical, ensure that you are connected to the Internet via a wired connection ===

The upgrade may change your wireless networking applications and drivers.

=== Ensure 16.10 is updated ===

==== Run Plasma Discover ====

Use <alt> <F2> to bring up krunner, and type plasma-discover and select Discover

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot1.png]]</nowiki>

----

==== Select Install Updates ====

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot2.png]]</nowiki>

----

==== Supply your password ====

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot4.png]]</nowiki>

----

==== Wait for updates to install ====

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot5.png]]</nowiki>

----

==== Re-boot if suggested ====

----

=== Upgrade ===

If for some reason Discover does not offer you the upgrade to 17.04, but you know it is available, then you can open Krunner, or Konsole (or other terminal), and run:

<code>kdesudo "do-release-upgrade -m desktop -f DistUpgradeViewKDE"</code>

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot6b.png]]</nowiki>

Again, sudo will ask for your password to proceed.

=== The Release Upgrade tool will be downloaded and started ===

17.04 introductory notes will be shown

Select Upgrade.

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot8.png]]</nowiki>

----

=== Allow the upgrade to start ===

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot10.png]]</nowiki>

Then Start Upgrade; it will download and install 17.04.

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot9.png]]</nowiki>

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot11.png]]</nowiki>

----

=== Wait (approximately an hour) ===

Enjoy a cup of coffee.

----

=== Remove obsolete packages ===

Click '''Remove'''. 

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot12.png]]</nowiki>

----

=== Restart your computer ===

It will ask you to restart your computer. Ensure you have no unsaved work open and click Restart Now.

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot13.png]]</nowiki>

----

== Welcome to Kubuntu 17.04 ==

Your computer should boot into Kubuntu 17.04, with the new Plasma 5.9.4 desktop

<nowiki>[[File:snapshot14.png]]</nowiki>
